DamageProperties.appliesGlobalModifierToHit: Applies Global Modifier to Hit (not functional)
DamageProperties.appliesGlobalModifierToDamaged: Applies Global Modifier to Damaged (not functional)
DamageProperties.defenseDifferenceMultiplier: Damage is multiplied by difference of defense (not functional)

ContextMenu.NotConsumable: The item is not configured as consumable

Dialog.CraftingDiagram: You have a recipe in hand

Armor.tooMuch: There is too much armor equipped of the same type

CritWound.HealingTime.Label: Days Until Healed
CritWound.SimpleCrackedJaw: The blow cracked your jaw, making it hard to speak clearly.
CritWound.SimpleDisfiguringScar: The blow mangled your face in some way. You are grotesque and difficult to look at.
CritWound.SimpleCrackedRibs: The blow cracked your ribs, making it painful to breathe and exert strength.
CritWound.SimpleForeignObject: The blow lodged a piece of clothing or armor in your wound, causing an infection.
CritWound.SimpleSprainedArm: The blow sprained your arm, making it difficult to manoeuvre.
CritWound.SimpleSprainedLeg: The blow sprained your leg, making it difficult to walk and manoeuvre.
CritWound.ComplexMinorHeadWound: The blow rattled your brain and caused some internal bleeding. It's hard to think straight.
CritWound.ComplexLostTeeth: The blow knocked out some teeth. Roll 1d10 to see how many teeth are lost.
CritWound.ComplexRupturedSpleen: A tear in your spleen begins bleeding profusely, making you woozy.
CritWound.ComplexBrokenRibs: The blow breaks your ribs, causing immense pain when you bend and strain.
CritWound.DifficultSkullFracture: The blow fractures a part of your skull, weakening your head and causing bleeding.
CritWound.DifficultConcussion: The blow caused a minor concussion.
CritWound.DifficultTornStomach: The blow rips through your stomach, pouring its contents into your gut.
CritWound.DifficultSuckingChestWound: The wound tears your lung, which fills your chest with air, crushing organs.
CritWound.DifficultCompoundArmFracture: The blow crushes your arm. Bone sticks out of the skin.
CritWound.DifficultCompoundLegFracture: The blow snaps your leg, rendering it useless.
CritWound.DeadlyDecapitated: The blow either snaps your neck or separates your head from your shoulders.
CritWound.DeadlyDamagedEye: The blow cuts into or indents your eyeball.
CritWound.DeadlySepticShock: The blow damages your intestines, letting waste enter your blood stream.
CritWound.DeadlyDismemberedArm: The blow renders your arm from your body or damages it beyond repair.
CritWound.DeadlyDismemberedLeg: The blow tears your leg from your body or damages it beyond repair.

Mod.SimpleCrackedJaw.None: You are at a -2 to Magical Skills & Verbal Combat (Charisma, Persuasion, Seduction, Leadership, Deceit, Social Etiquette and Intimidation).
Mod.SimpleCrackedJaw.Stabilized: You are at a -1 to Magical Skills & Verbal Combat.
Mod.SimpleCrackedJaw.Treated: You are at a -1 to Magical Skills.
Mod.SimpleDisfiguringScar.None: You take a -3 to empathic Verbal Combat (Charisma, Persuasion, Deceit, Social Etiquette, and Leadership).
Mod.SimpleDisfiguringScar.Stabilized: You take a -1 to emphatic Verbal Combat.
Mod.SimpleCrackedRibs.None: You take a -2 to BODY. This does not affect health points.
Mod.SimpleCrackedRibs.Stabilized: You are at a -1 to BODY.
Mod.SimpleForeignObject.None: Your Recovery and Critical Healing are affected.
Mod.SimpleForeignObject.Stabilized: Your Recovery & Critical Healing are halved.
Mod.SimpleForeignObject.Treated: You take a -2 to Recovery and a -1 to your Critical Healing.
Mod.SimpleSprainedArm.None: You take a -2 to actions that use the arm.
Mod.SimpleSprainedArm.Stabilized: You are at a -1 to actions with that arm.
Mod.SimpleSprainedLeg.None: You take a -2 to SPD, Dodge/Escape, and Athletics.
Mod.SimpleSprainedLeg.Stabilized: You take a -1 to SPD, Dodge/Escape, and Athletics.
Mod.ComplexMinorHeadWound.None: You take a -1 to INT, WILL and STUN.
Mod.ComplexMinorHeadWound.Stabilized: You are at a -1 to INT and WILL.
Mod.ComplexMinorHeadWound.Treated: You are at a -1 to WILL.
Mod.ComplexLostTeeth.None: You take a -3 to magical skills and Verbal Combat.
Mod.ComplexLostTeeth.Stabilized: You take a -2 to magical skills and Verbal Combat.
Mod.ComplexLostTeeth.Treated: You take a -1 to magical skills and Verbal Combat.
Mod.ComplexRupturedSpleen.None: Make a Stun save every 5 rounds. This wound induced bleeding.
Mod.ComplexRupturedSpleen.Stabilized: You must make a Stun save every 10 Rounds.
Mod.ComplexBrokenRibs.None: Take a -2 to BODY and a -1 to REF and DEX.
Mod.ComplexBrokenRibs.Stabilized: You are at a -1 to BODY and REF.
Mod.ComplexBrokenRibs.Treated: You are at a -1 to BODY.
Mod.ComplexFracturedArm.None: You take a -3 to actions with that arm.
Mod.ComplexFracturedArm.Stabilized: You take a -2 to actions with that arm.
Mod.ComplexFracturedArm.Treated: You take a -1 to actions with that arm.
Mod.ComplexFracturedLeg.None: You take a -3 to SPD, Dodge/Escape, and Athletics.
Mod.ComplexFracturedLeg.Stabilized: You take a -2 to SPD, Dodge/Escape, and Athletics.
Mod.DifficultSkullFracture.None: You take a -1 to INT and DEX, and take quadruple damage from head wounds.
Mod.DifficultSkullFracture.Stabilized: Take a -1 to INT and DEX and quadruple damage from head wounds.
Mod.DifficultSkullFracture.Treated: You take quadruple damage from head wounds.
Mod.DifficultConcussion.None: Make a Stun save every 1d6 rounds and take a -2 to INT, REF, and DEX.
Mod.DifficultConcussion.Stabilized: You take a -1 to INT, REF, and DEX.
Mod.DifficultConcussion.Treated: You take a -1 to INT and DEX.
Mod.DifficultTornStomach.None: You take a -2 to all actions and 4 points of acid damage per round.
Mod.DifficultTornStomach.Stabilized: You take a -2 to all actions.
Mod.DifficultTornStomach.Treated: You take a -1 to all actions.
Mod.DifficultSuckingChestWound.None: You take a -3 to BODY and SPD. You also start suffocating.
Mod.DifficultSuckingChestWound.Stabilized: You take a -2 to BODY and SPD.
Mod.DifficultSuckingChestWound.Treated: You take a -1 to BODY and SPD.
Mod.DifficultCompoundArmFracture.None: The arm is rendered useless and you start bleeding.
Mod.DifficultCompoundArmFracture.Treated: That arm must remain in a sling, but it can hold things.
Mod.DifficultCompoundLegFracture.None: Quarter SPD, Dodge/Escape, and Athletics. This induces bleeding.
Mod.DeadlyDamagedEye.None: You take a -5 to sight-based Awareness and -4 to DEX. This wounds begins bleeding.
Mod.DeadlyDamagedEye.Stabilized: You take a -3 to sight-based Awareness and -2 to DEX.
Mod.DeadlyDamagedEye.Treated: Permanent -1 to sight-based Awareness and DEX.
Mod.DeadlyHeartDamage.None: Make an immediate Death save. If you survive, the wound is bleeding and you must quarter your Stamina, SPD, and BODY.
Mod.DeadlyHeartDamage.Stabilized: You halve your Stamina, SPD, and BODY.
Mod.DeadlyHeartDamage.Treated: You take a +2 damage from bleeding permanently.
Mod.DeadlySepticShock.None: Quarter your Stamina, take a -3 INT, WILL, REF, and DEX. You are poisoned.
Mod.DeadlySepticShock.Stabilized: Your Stamina is halved and you take a -1 to INT, WILL, REF, and DEX.
Mod.DeadlySepticShock.Treated: You take a -5 to Stamina permanently.
Mod.DeadlyDismemberedArm.None: The arm cannot be used and you start bleeding.
Mod.DeadlyDismemberedArm.Treated: That arm can be replaced with a prosthetic.
Mod.DeadlyDismemberedLeg.None: Quarter your SPD, Dodge/Escape, and Athletics. This wound begins bleeding.
Mod.DeadlyDismemberedLeg.Stabilized: You quarter your SPD, Dodge/Escape, and Athletics.
Mod.DeadlyDismemberedLeg.Treated: The leg can be replaced with a prosthetic.

Monster.dontAddAttr: Do not add attributes to skill value
Monster.exportLootGenerated: Item was successfully generated with help of roll table. It was added to the Loot sheet
Monster.exportLootInvalidItemError: Item doesn't exists in the compendium. Use standard loot generator instead
Monster.exportLootToManyRollTablesError: Too many roll tables for the item found in the compendium. Use standard loot generator instead

Spell.staminaDialog: How many stamina do you use?

Chat.SaveText: To succeed you need to roll below

Settings.AdrenalineDetails: Adrenaline is the willpower to go on and Fight harder in dire situations
Settings.displayReputationHint: Allows players to see and modify their reputation
Settings.useVerbalCombatRule: Use the Verbal Combat Optional Rule
Settings.useVerbalCombatRuleHint: Allows players to see their resolve value and roll for Verbal combat actions
Settings.clickableImageItemTypesHint: A comma-separated list of item types, where a checkbox can be set. If it is checked, the players can click on the item image from their inventory to see a larger version of it. Possible types are 'valuable', 'weapon', 'armor', 'alchemical', 'diagrams', 'component'.
Settings.globalModifierLookupCompendiumHint: If a global modifier that should be activated is not found on the character sheet, it will search this compendium for it

Damage.RemoveSP: Remove SP before applying location modifier.
Damage.NotEnough: Not enough damage to pierce the armor
Damage.ToMuchShield: All damage was absorbed by shield or cover

Context.SelectActor: At least one actor must be selected

verbalCombat.Title: Verbal Combat
verbalCombat.SeduceEffect: Defender is a little hot under the collar and takes a cumulative +2 damage from each Seduction for the combat.
verbalCombat.PersuadeEffect: If you end a combat with a successful Persuasion check, you have convinced them to agree with you.
verbalCombat.AppealEffect: The defender thinks you probably have the right idea and takes a cumulative +1 damage from empathetic attacks for each time you succeed at Appeal.
verbalCombat.BefriendEffect: If you end a combat with a successful Befriend attack, you have made a friend of your opponent.
verbalCombat.DeceiveEffect: If you end a combat with a successful Deceit check, you have convinced the defender of the lie.
verbalCombat.RidiculeEffect: If you successfully Ridicule a person in public, you also lower their Reputation with those people by 2 for each successful Ridicule. This penalty lasts for one day.
verbalCombat.IntimidateEffect: Anyone you intimidate is afraid of you and takes a cumulative +4 damage from Intimidation for the combat.
verbalCombat.CounterargueEffect: Instead of taking a defensive action you can make an attack that negates the first attack. If you beat the opponent’s roll, their attack is negated and your’s does damage.
verbalCombat.RomanceEffect: The Romanced party falls in love with the Romancer. This gives them a -3 against the Romancer in Verbal Combat, but only as long as the attacker continues to convince the defender they are in love and treats them well. If the romance ends poorly, the defender gets a permanent +3 against the attacker’s empathetic attacks.
verbalCombat.StudyEffect: Studying allows you to look for or probe weaknesses in your opponent’s mental armor. Roll against their INTx3. If you succeed, you get +2 to Verbal Combat for one round.
verbalCombat.ImplyEffect: Implying allows you to suggest something good or bad about your current argument. If you succeed, you lower your opponent’s defenses by -4. You can only use Imply once per combat
verbalCombat.BribeEffect: For every 50 Crowns you offer, you gain +1 to your empathetic Verbal Combat rolls for the rest of the fight if you succeed on your Gambling roll.

craft.InsufficientComponents: Not enough components to perform real craft
craft.ItemsSuccessfullyDeleted: Items were successfully deleted from actor
craft.SuccessfulCraftForNothing: You should have specified associated item to allow its craft. Your components are in place.

err.CraftItemDeletion: Incorrect amount of items were deleted from the actor
err.NoItemsOfSpecificType: No items of specific type are available for actor

magic.1-6: Magic sparks and crackles and you take 1 point of damage for every point you fumbled by, but the spell still goes off.
magic.7-9: The magic that is already partially through you ignites inside you. Not only does the spell fail but you suffer an elemental fumble effect as noted below.
magic.>9: Your magic explodes with a catastrophic effect. Not only do you suffer an elemental fumble effect, but any focusing item you are carrying explodes as if it were a bomb (doing 1d10 damage) with a 2 meter radius

meleeAttack.6: Your weapon glances off and you are staggered.
meleeAttack.7: Your weapon lodges in a nearby object and it takes 1 round to free.
meleeAttack.8: You damage your weapon severely. Your weapon takes 1d10 points of reliability damage.
meleeAttack.9: You manage to wound yourself. Roll for location.
meleeAttack.>9: You wound a nearby ally. Roll location on a random ally within range.

armedDefense.6: Your weapon takes 1d6 extra points of reliability damage.
armedDefense.7: Your weapon is knocked from your hand and flies 1d6 meters away in a random direction (see Scatter table).
armedDefense.8: You are knocked to the ground. You are now prone and must make a Stun save.
armedDefense.9: Your weapon takes 2d6 extra points of reliability damage.
armedDefense.>9: Your weapon ricochets back and hits you. Roll for location.

rangedAttack.6-7: The ammunition you fired, or weapon you threw, hits something hard, breaking.
rangedAttack.8-9: Your bowstring comes partially undone, your crossbow jams, or you drop your thrown weapon. It takes 1 round to undo this.
rangedAttack.>9: You strike one of your allies with a ricochet. Roll location on a random ally within range

unarmed.6: You are knocked off balance and are staggered.
unarmed.7: You trip on something and fall prone.
unarmed.8: You trip and fall prone. You must make a Stun save.
unarmed.9: You trip and hit your head. You are knocked prone, take 1d6 points of non-lethal damage to the head, and must make a Stun save.
unarmed.>9: You fail horribly and not only fall prone but also take 1d6 lethal damage to the head and must make a Stun save.
